title: Gmina
summary: The gmina (Polish: [ˈɡmʲina], plural gminy [ˈɡmʲinɨ], from German Gemeinde meaning commune) is the principal unit of the administrative division of Poland, similar to a municipality. As of 1 January 2019, there were 2477 communes throughout the country, encompassing 940 cities and over 43,000 villages.[1]
